title: Calories in Black Olives
meta_description: Discover calories in black olives per 100 g serving, including carbs, fat, protein, sodium details, and easy tweaks for your diet.
assumptions: Canned, ripe black olives, drained, pitted; standard variety without added oils or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, ripeness, packing method (brine vs. oil), and size; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of black olives contains about 115 kcal, mostly from healthy fats.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: With added feta cheese (10 g per 100 g olives)

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g black olives?
faqs.a: Approximately 115 kcal per 100 g drained black olives.

faqs.q: Are black olives high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 10.7 g total fat per 100 g, mostly monounsaturated.

faqs.q: What's the sodium content in black olives?
faqs.a: Around 735 mg per 100 g due to brining; rinse to reduce.

faqs.q: Do black olives have carbs or fiber?
faqs.a: 6.3 g carbs and 1.6 g fiber per 100 g; low sugar at 0 g.

faqs.q: How do green vs. black olives compare in calories?
faqs.a: Similar; black olives are slightly higher at ~115 kcal vs. ~145 kcal per 100 g for green.
